channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Can the world's largest music festival be sustainable? Glastonbury is trying
item.description: Efforts to make the world’s biggest music festival sustainable affect everything from trash pickup to wheelchair access to child safety. Is it possible for 200,000+ campers to "leave no trace?"
item.content:encoded: Efforts to make the world’s biggest music festival sustainable affect everything from trash pickup to wheelchair access to child safety. Is it possible for 200,000+ campers to "leave no trace?"
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: After Roe v Wade, Supreme Court overturns another major legal precedent
item.description: NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben asks Harvard Law professor Andrew Mergen about the Supreme Court's decision to overrule the "Chevron doctrine."
item.content:encoded: NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben asks Harvard Law professor Andrew Mergen about the Supreme Court's decision to overrule the "Chevron doctrine."
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Supreme Court upholds Oregon city’s ban on homeless people camping in public spaces
item.description: On Friday, the U.S. Supreme Court issued an opinion in a case centered in Grants Pass, Ore., that will impact homelessness policy across the West. It might have less impact in Grants Pass due to an Oregon state law that passed in 2021.
item.content:encoded: On Friday, the U.S. Supreme Court issued an opinion in a case centered in Grants Pass, Ore., that will impact homelessness policy across the West. It might have less impact in Grants Pass due to an Oregon state law that passed in 2021.
item.dc:creator: Jane Vaughan

item.title: Week in politics: Presidential debate, Supreme Court decisions
item.description: The reverberations from Thursday's presidential debate continue, alongside consequential Supreme Court rulings.
item.content:encoded: The reverberations from Thursday's presidential debate continue, alongside consequential Supreme Court rulings.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Dell's return to office policy is raising questions about the future of work
item.description: Business Insider's Polly Thompson tells NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben about the controversy surrounding Dell's return-to-office policies.
item.content:encoded: Business Insider's Polly Thompson tells NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben about the controversy surrounding Dell's return-to-office policies.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Saturday Sports: NBA draft, Olympic doping
item.description: NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben and Meadowlark Media's Howard Bryant discuss the NBA draft and Olympic doping.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben and Meadowlark Media's Howard Bryant discuss the NBA draft and Olympic doping.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: What is Hamas' strategy for a ceasefire and conditions for the end of war?
item.description: NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben speaks to Hussein Ibish, a senior resident scholar at the Arab Gulf States Institute, about Hamas’ strategy for the war in Gaza.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Danielle Kurtzleben speaks to Hussein Ibish, a senior resident scholar at the Arab Gulf States Institute, about Hamas’ strategy for the war in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: In a post-debate rally, Biden showcases a different side
item.description: One day after facing off on the debate stage, President Biden and former President Donald Trump held campaign rallies that built off of Thursday's debate performance.
item.content:encoded: One day after facing off on the debate stage, President Biden and former President Donald Trump held campaign rallies that built off of Thursday's debate performance.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Fetterman traveled to Israel and met with Netanyahu despite blowback on the left
item.description: Why Sen. John Fetterman, D-Pa., visited Israel this week, and how the visit underscores tensions among Democrats over the war in Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
Why Sen. John Fetterman, D-Pa., visited Israel this week, and how the visit underscores tensions among Democrats over the war in Gaza.

(Image credit: Maya Levin for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Wow! These amazing drone's-eye views of our world are up for best drone photo
item.description: Here's a selection of finalists for the Siena Drone Photo Award competition of 2024: a wrestling match, an awesome bridge, a snow-covered village and pelicans!
item.content:encoded:
Here's a selection of finalists for the Siena Drone Photo Award competition of 2024: a wrestling match, an awesome bridge, a snow-covered village and pelicans!

(Image credit: Sanchayan Chowdhury)
item.dc:creator: Kamala Thiagarajan
